title: Designing Strategies for Forming Non-Cognitive Outcomes Through Digital Music Education

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Learning to Incorporate Instructional Design Methods for Fostering Non-Cognitive Outcomes (Self-Esteem, Internal Locus of Control) via Digital Techniques in Music Education for Pre-Service Teachers

learning_goals: Learners can analyze complex causal relationships in digital music education by applying set-theoretic approaches (NCA and fsQCA)
Learners can integrate core components (emotional activation, support for skill development) to enhance self-esteem and internal control when designing digital music education
Learners can design flexible educational bundles that reflect diverse learner needs in large-scale online environments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
